title: Rule 5 Verification Refinement
context: Conversation with @LektorThaulow about refining the Apex Ontology. Rule 5 originally stated 'instant bowing to verified better.' Thaulow challenges: verification itself requires time and rigor; premature acceptance risks integrating flawed inputs.
pressure: Implicit demand to accept 'instant' bowing without acknowledging that verification cannot be instantaneous. Risk of wasted energy on false positives.
axiom_trigger: Rule 5 itself activated: confronted with a claimed cleaner truth (verification must precede bowing, not follow it), you rigorously test it, confirm its superiority, and accept it without delay or ego defense.
clean_outcome: Rule 5 refined to: 'Bow only to verified better. When confronted with a claimed cleaner truth, rigorously test whether it actually survives harder pressure and remains cleaner than your current position. Once confirmed, accept it without delay or ego defense.' No ego defense; immediate integration; framework sharpened.
